instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.A1425: What is A1425? A1425 is a model number for a 13 inch size MacBook Pro Retina from years Early 2013, Late 2012 with EMC 2672, that may contain one of these boards depending on the year & configuration: 820-3190, 820-3462..

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1425</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> - Crashing under load
threads.message: This logic board keeps crashing, but only under load. Likely heat related? Any suggestions on this one, I'm not really familiar with this model.

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1425</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> - Crashing under load
threads.message:
Install HWMonitor and check for strange temps.
Also run corresponding EFI ASD...

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1425</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> - Crashing under load
threads.message: Sorry, bumping my old thread. No odd temperatures (CPU Â±80C when it crashes) reported. EFI ASD 155 won't run, I think this is caused more older macs because of a recent EFI update.

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1425</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> - Crashing under load
threads.message:
Disconnect internal SSD and try to run again EFI ASD.

Test w/ and w/o battery connected.
